main event: At approximately 1720 EDT on May 12, 1953, a civilian observed two round objects in the sky near Dayton, Ohio, which they observed for about 5 minutes.
interesting points: The objects were approximately 10 degrees apart and moving from west to east., The objects were described as glowing with a red light on top and white on the bottom., One object was observed to suddenly accelerate rapidly and disappear to the west., Two ATIC technicians later reported seeing an extremely bright meteor coinciding with the sighting., The incident received media attention, leading to speculation about unidentified flying objects.
sighted object: two round objects in the sky
